content: elbows up elbows up cowl 2 yarn notes to avoid jogs uneven stripes at the beginning of 100 m/119 yards light fingering weight yarn rounds i used this jogless join method in main colour natural to avoid long floats over the maple leaf section 175 m/191 yards light fingering weight yarn i used the ladderback jacquard technique in contrast colour red because chart 2 is so wide it has been split into the sample cowl used rauma lamull as the 3 parts when you get to these charts start with main colour and two laceweight yarns held round 1 of chart 2a followed by round 1 of chart together julie asselin merletto + greta and 2b and then round 1 of chart 2c continue as the fibers maclace 600 as the contrast established until you have completed round 11 of colour all charts to omit the words replace chart 2 with chart needles 4 2 5mm/us 1 5 circular needle 60 cm 3 mm/us 2 5 circular needle 60 cm instructions gauge with cc and smaller needles cast on 165 sts leaving a 70 cm tail place marker and join in a 16 sts = 5 cm/2 in stockinette stitch round k 7 rnds p 1 round k 8 rnds on next round blocked increase 15 sts evenly spaced = 180 sts change to larger needles and work chart 1 blocked measurements followed by chart 2 and chart 3 height 19 cm/7 5 change to smaller needles break mc and circumference 59 cm/23 continue with cc decrease 15 sts evenly spaced on next round = 165 sts k 7 rnds p 1 round k 6 rnds bind off leaving a 70 cm tail abbreviations cc contrast colour fold down the hems at the purl lines and sew in decrease decrease place increase increase k knit mc
